rtr1_host.usage: One of the router on which the interface config is to be done

rtr1_interface.usage: Name of the interface which needs to be brought up and configured on router 1

rtr1_interface_config.description: Configuration of the interface to be added on router.
rtr1_interface_config.usage: The configuration to be added under rtr1_interface of router1_host. copy_from is optional, it should be used if the config has to be copied from some other interface. If so, configuration except ipv4/ipv6 addresses under given interface will be copied.

rtr2_host.usage: The other router on which the interface config is done

rtr2_interface.usage: Name of the interface which needs to be brought up and configured on router 2

rtr2_interface_config.description: Configuration of the interface to be added on router.
rtr2_interface_config.usage: The configuration to be addded under rtr2_interface of router2_host. copy_from is optional, it should be used if the config has to be copied from some other interface. If so, configuration except ipv4/ipv6 addresses under given interface will be copied.

create_interface.description: Should the interface be created on router?
create_interface.usage: The create interface should be set to "true" for logical and sub-interfaces

provider.description: Provider to be used to connect to the router

mop_timeout.description: Timeout duration for MoP i.e. maximum time spent in Running/Paused states. e.g. 900s, 10m, 1.5h, etc. Valid time units are 'ns', 'us' (or 'Âµs'), 'ms', 's', 'm', 'h'.
